content.prompt: Using recursion,    complete the doubleCharacters method    so that it returns a string in which the characters of    the parameter string are doubled.    Examples: doubleCharacters("") => "" doubleCharacters("a") => "aa" doubleCharacters("abc") => "aabbcc" doubleCharacters("Hello") => "HHeelllloo"    Hints: The substring method can be used to get a string        containing the characters of the original string from a        start index (inclusive) to an end index (exclusive).        For example, s.substring(1, s.length())        returns a substring containing all of the characters        of s except for the first.          The charAt method can be used to return the        character at a specified index in a string.        For example, s.charAt(0) returns the first        character of s.          Make sure that your recursive call(s) make progress        towards a base case.          You can use string concatenation to construct the result        string.  For example, if c is a char        variable, then "" + c + c        is a string that contains two repetitions of the        character that c contains.
